website_summaries.verdict: These wireless earbuds are perfect for even the most particular athlete; they include a variety of ear hooks, so you can always get the perfect fit (and the perfect sound). Our favorite part: they’re waterproof, so they’ll even go with you on a run in the rain.
pros: They can last up to 10 hours on a single charge
Anker offers an 18-month warranty, which is well above average
cons: The buttons are a little flimsy, so it’s often hard to tell if they’ve registered anything when you push them
All buttons are on one side, which can make it feel lopsided and distracting during exercise

customer_reviews.title: Surprised by the quality of this Anker product.
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this pair of Soundbuds Slim because the first pair, which I gave my wife for Mother's Day, worked so well that I ended up borrowing them too often. When they arrived today, I first noticed that the flap covering the USB charging port wouldn't stay on no matter what I did. The first pair wasn't like this. As I looked further, I noticed a earwax looking substance inside the earbuds themselves. I took the rubber pieces off each one and confirmed that they were covered in this unknown substance. I've attached pictures. I'm very surprised because I've purchased many different Anker products in the past and haven't had any issues even close to this.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: BATTERY LIFE IS TERRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 6 months, but from day one never had the battery life advertised and now after putting in a complaint when the battery finally failed, with their customer service, I have heard nothing more than sorry take a picture of the item and we will get back to you. Ticket # 49979118 I need new headphones Anker!!! Update: new headphones on the way going to 3 stars for customer service, will update to 5 if replacement solves battery issue. Update: one star as the new headphones died in less than 2 weeks and will not hold a charge, i'm at the end of my patience. I can't recommend this product. .
customer_reviews.author: Anonomys

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn’t recommend this product. The right side of this headset stop working after 2 months. Poor quality. Don’t waste your money. Update : August 1, 2020. My original review was poor. However the follow up from Anker made a big difference. Customer service was outstanding to follow up and resolve the issue. They did send me a replacement but what keeps me as a loyal customer to continue buying their products was the great customer service. The replacement by the way is working great, no issues. I also own a few of the Anker USB wall chargers, by far better than other brands that I’ve purchased. Highly recommend Anker products!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Ibanez

customer_reviews.title: Look at others before this one.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these on one of the daily deals. Although decent for the money, there are much better ones on the market for the same price. I get a out 3.5 hours battery life on a full charge. Sound quality is decent for this price point, but nothing great. Highs are tiny and bass is shallow. No low battery indicator. This is really annoying, since battery life is already short. The headphones just shut off when battery is low, no pending indication of beeps or low battery voice prompts. The ear fit is ok, but never seem to get perfect, even with a assortment of sizes. Will be looking for a replacement unit.
customer_reviews.author: SEA 3

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price, but the sound is a little tinny. It is especially noticeable when listening to spoken word. EDIT: The day after posting this, Anker reached out to me by email, offering me the Surge buds free of charge. They did not ask me alter my review in any way. After spending some time using those, I would recommend them over the Slims. These are great, but the bass on the Surge is much better. If you are looking for a cheaper "backup" pair, definitely get these. But if you are looking for an affordable daily driver, get the Surge. tl;dr these are good, Surge is better, Anker customer retention is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Keller

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic customer service
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: Originally griped about how it died out of nowhere. Customer service was very helpful and quickly resolved the matter. Everything after this sentence is the original post. Sound quality is great, especially if you're a fan of bass. Build quality is superb, and it stays in your ear no problem. Had to charge it every other workout, though. And now after a couple months of using it, it just died with no warning (there's a sound warning when you're running on low battery) and stayed dead. Doesn't charge, doesn't light up. Was good while it lasted, but if you want something that lasts, I wouldn't bet on this.
customer_reviews.author: Josef Karlos V. Bitanga

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: My boys love these! I bought them for Christmas after they had and lost more expensive air pods. These are a good balance between inexpensive and effective. They arrived charged up and battery life is really good for wireless earbuds. I chose them because we trust the anker brand for charging cables and rechargeable batteries. Like the other anker products these earbuds do not disappoint. And at the price I paid I won’t be disappointed if they end up losing them in a few months. They love them and I love the price. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Good product, sounds ok, decent battery life.
customer_reviews.text: These sound ok, are reasonably comfortable, and the battery lasts a pretty long time. The product is five stars for audio quality/$. Not absolute audio quality. Amazon asked me about noise cancellation. These do not have that feature. I don't know about longevity, but my previous ankers were going strong after a year and a half when the dog chewed them up. One nitpick. The audible statement of battery level is misleading. "Medium" means low, "low" means nearly dead.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Pritts

customer_reviews.title: I like em... not as much as the Soundbud sport, but they'll do!
customer_reviews.text: I use wireless earbuds during weightlifting and workouts, and these stay in my ear and do the trick. I have had two pairs previously of the Anker Soundbud Sport, and I LOVED that model. These are bigger and feel heavier, and the super easy controls were moved from on the earbuds themselves to on the wire, which I find more annoying and difficult to adjust, but they stay in my ears and the sound quality is the same. Really wish the Soundbud Sport would come back, but these are good enough for now! Might look for a different brand/model next time.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a week
customer_reviews.text: Headphone have an great sound for the price and the wasn’t ready to jump into the expensive end of the Bests or Bose wireless headphones, so after watching /reading reviews I thought I would give them a try. The large control piece bothered me but I could get use to it maybe if they lasted longer than a week! I charged them when I first got them and tried out all of the ear pieces which were soooo many. When to charge if for a second time and they never changed!!! Tried a different outlet and even my computer. No good. I’m really disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: They stay in no matter what I'm doing at the gym or around the house. They cancel the grunting guy sound at the gym, my roommates TV show while I'm in the kitchen, the construction guys when I'm shoveling snow, and my kids when I just need a few minutes to breathe and listen to a song. I fully charged them when I first got them and haven't charged them again yet, after probably close to 15-20 hours. I'm pretty impressed with them. The sound quality it great too!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly fine for this style and this price point
customer_reviews.text: I have sworn by Tao Tronics' similar product for a few years but these are pretty good too. The earbuds actually feel more comfortable than the Taos. These, and really all earbuds, are not ideal for audiophiles who need to hear every precious note in a song, but they're great for people who just want to listen to music while working out or to podcasts on the train. They provide clear, reasonable sound for those uses at this price. The only con is the buttons aren't as pronounced as the Taos, I like having buttons that I can tell very easily what they do. Maybe a different shape for the middle button would solve this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They work like they should...
customer_reviews.text: Headphones work well and are pretty secure fitting. Occasionally one will pop out when I take a big jump on the mountain bike, but usually only when my teeth and eyeballs feel like they are going to fall out as well. Sound quality is good and the range is quite good. I can get off the bike and move quite a ways away before it starts to break up
customer_reviews.author: Bryan in Tacoma

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless headphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pair I ordered but for good reason. My wife accidentally washed my first pair and my daughter took my second pair for her iPhone. These ear buds are comfortable in the ear and the wings kept them in place. The sound is really good even if the bass isn't really deep. Battery life and distance is really good too. I have a Google pixel 3xl so I had to embrace no headphone jack. I use them for everything including phone calls. The magnetic ends keep them around my neck when I am working, shopping and exercising. The button controls help keep my phone in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Timothyech

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace the black ones that I managed to lose. Hey, they're cheap enough, I don't worry about it. I'd like a little more bass, but then, I have reverse slope hearing loss (I'm losing my hearing from the bass end first, not the high end first), so I can't say that I'm surprised. Yes, I'm an old fart. But they work great (especially when I manage to turn them on, instead of thinking that I'm hearing with them, and it's just the phone... Yeah, that's me!). Battery life is sufficient, considering how small they actually are.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Price

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great but not so hiigh
customer_reviews.text: This pair of headphones are super cool. Lots of rubber stuff that you can combine to fix your ears and don't fall. Long battery life: The longer time without discharged has been like 6 hours with them turned on: couple of calls and about 1 or 2 hours of music playing. What I don't like is they are not very loud. I have the black ones and they are louder with the same sound quality (nice bass tho). If you go on bike trough the streets of new york on heavy traffic... you wont enjoy the music so much, even though they cancel outside noise very well.
customer_reviews.author: cao

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Value
customer_reviews.text: I got these for the gym so I won't feel bad destroying my non-sweat resistant AirPods, while enjoying a solution that stays in my ears. I did add a set of Comply foam tips for about the same price as this headset, but it wasn't super necessary; just a personal preference. Battery life is actually a bit ridiculous. I charge them perhaps once every three weeks, even though they still have 40% battery life. Sound quality is good. Like all of Anker's products, it is wonderful value.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Blue

customer_reviews.title: Awesome set, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! The first set of ear buds I have found that will stay in my ears. Many adjustable sizes, never would’ve thought I needed a different size for each ear. My son tries talking to me while I have them in and I hear nothing he says! I don’t have to turn up the music super loud either. My only complaint is that they stick outward quite a bit and are painful to lie on. I got them to help me sleep, because of my loud neighbors upstairs. But I’m a side sleeper so could only have one in. And if I rolled over to the other side, it would be painful and wake me up.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones as a Lightning Deal. While I have some large noise cancelling headphones for long journeys, I wanted something compact that I could carry around with me all the time. The sound quality for the price is very good. I found the noise isolating to be less than I needed so I bought some memory foam tips (from Amazon) and it is much improved. When I had some concerns about the product, I emailed the manufacturer and Michelle was quick to respond to all my messages and quickly resolved the situation. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Mark R

customer_reviews.title: Love my Anker earbuds
customer_reviews.text: They're my favorite earbuds now. The sound quality improved after a few hours of listening. The magnet that allows them to click together is very handy when I don't want to take them off my neck, or if I need to chat with someone or hear something. The wings keep them in my ear nicely. I have yet to run out of battery time, but I don't listen for 10 hours at a stretch either. Great sound for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Renifer

customer_reviews.title: Good for your phone or even Amazon Fire TV.
customer_reviews.text: I use these to sync up my Amazon Fire TV. It auto dects the buds after you pair them. My advice is to have one pair deticated to it and not to your phone. That's why I bought a second pair. I also have the airpods pro but they're keep on getting disconnect and now way to adjust the volume. I'd recommend it, it's fairly cheap and good quality. No real noise cancellation but it helps with the noisy window fan I have in my room.
customer_reviews.author: Restasis

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far there good. Not sure about the long run. Sounds quality is pretty good. But I like how the buds fit and all the different pieces are a nice touch if the ones in it don’t fit. Wire feels good and the buttons to answer calls and all that isn’t too heavy which is something that I tend to Way more then I should in headphones that are suppose To be for running. Hopefully they last longer then my last pair
customer_reviews.author: pparker1

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: So, to start -- these are sub-$30 BT earbuds. I didn't expect premium quality, just good. My first pair worked and sounded great, however after about 5 months, the cord dryrotted and caused the wire to be affected...and earbuds died. Now, anker lists an 18-month warranty. So I went thru the site, did the warranty and I have to say -- talk about amazing customer service. Easy, fast and very pleasant. New pair came within days and are working great. Hopefully these ones hold up longer. For the price, you really can't go wrong. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Really great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: A year ago, I bought an Anker power bank, which I love. Then Amazon suggested that I might like some Anker headphones. I bought those. Then Amazon suggested this and I love them! They have great sound quality, They really fit my ear well and they come with extra ear pieces for different size ears. They fit so well that I use them on flights instead of earplugs. I frequently fall asleep in these - they are that comfortable. They also have a great microphone for phone calls.
customer_reviews.author: Xenophon212730

customer_reviews.title: Sound was ok Day 1 but then couldn't get them ...
customer_reviews.text: Sound was ok Day 1 but then couldn't get them to pair with my Mac, then they lost connection with my iphone, then couldn't get them to turn on. I did some troubleshooting, but honestly, who needs this level of aggravation? If I can't just stick wired buds into the phone, the I should be able to instantly turn on wireless, have them pair, and maintain the pair. Return time.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Landy

customer_reviews.title: Done With Anker Headphones
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pair of Anker headphones I ordered, and the second I'm returning. I upgraded to the newer model and was surprised to find the sound was so tinney and shallow. I assumed it was a defective model. Trying these, the sound isn't much better. It's just as tinney, and there's static whenever it connects. Either this is another defective model, or Anker headphones aren't as good as I remember. Either way, I'm looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Kmn

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, but then the battery died. Update 9/27/2018
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality was great. Very good bass. Connecting it to my phone was super easy. I loved the magnetic snap around my neck. Not very loud for calls because people on the receiving end can't hear me very well. The battery ended up dying and now it no longer charges. I kind of want my money back... So it's just sitting in a pile on my desk. 2/5 stars Update: I was sent a new one after the review. Works great for now. Appreciate the customer service. 4/5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Jon P.

customer_reviews.title: These are amazing little headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I use headphones daily at work so comfort is s as must, along with battery life. I’m cheap so I refuse to pay outrageous dough for headphones when a set like these work so well! I consistently get 7-8 hours plus (have never had them die so I can’t vouch for a max time) on a charge. They are comfortable and sounds good to me! Admittedly, I’m not super picky about the sound. Completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Kim H.

customer_reviews.title: Listening and talking very good quality!
customer_reviews.text: My adult son turned me on to these! I walk almost everyday and often talk to him while walking. My old set often didn’t work well in wind or background noise. So he told me that he had these. I couldn’t tell he wasn’t talking on his phone directly! They come with many ear fittings and the battery lasts forever! I would think the would cost much more than they do for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amyeliz

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price and performance. Better for working out than the completely wireless ones. you can still remove one or both and leave them hanging around your neck without worrying about dropping them. They include a charging cable, a clip for your clothes, a little round piece to adjust the extra cable length if you want to. Also it comes with different sizes AND types of ear silicone buds (with and without the little horn), anyone should find a good fit, and a little pouch to carry all the above.
customer_reviews.author: romodoc

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the gym
customer_reviews.text: I needed something wireless for the gym so that I can listen to music and not accidentally pull the phone out and onto the floor when moving. Works perfectly for this need. Battery life was about a week, used strictly for daily workouts. Note that the noise cancellation is passive in that you have something jammed into your ear rather than active cancellation. Not a problem, just wanted to be clear.
customer_reviews.author: Denise as Betty Bike

customer_reviews.title: For $20 these headphones are awesome. After 1 day of use
customer_reviews.text: For $20 these headphones are awesome. After 1 day of use, they seem to have about 5-6 hours of use until they die (pretty average, the $150 iPhone ear buds have about the same). Pleasantly surprised that they are semi-noise cancelling and have a lot of controls for just 3 buttons that work through my iPhone and Macbook Air. Range in my office is about 30-35 feet with no walls and about 20 if there's a wall or two in it. Connected right up with all my devices, even my 6 year old piece of crap PC. Did they even have bluetooth 6 years ago? Seriously, would recommend these over those overpriced beats or anything Apple.
customer_reviews.author: that guy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient but lousy sound quality
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are very comfortable, and compact for travel. But I'm surprised at the reviews that mention good sound quality from these headphones. I am not super picky about sound quality, which is why I didn't want to spend a lot on headphones. But I am actually missing some of the ranges of the music with these headphones, especially bass. These headphones are fine for podcasts, but are simply unacceptable for music. Also very quiet- I have to turn the volume almost all the way up to hear anything. Very disappointed, will definitely be looking for a new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Eckley

customer_reviews.title: Great quality headset from a reputable brand
customer_reviews.text: I've been sceptical switching from wired Sony extra bass, but this is the perfect companion on my multi-hour walks for podcasts and music. Impeccable experience, all expectations met and exceeded. They're lightweight and sit great. Have nice bass and magnetic heads, sound for power up / power down, buttons, and status light all come in handy. Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Umberto Moretti

customer_reviews.title: Larger than hoped, little bass
customer_reviews.text: This price is right, and there are no obvious issues. These are ok. They function, the battery lasts me at least a week at 2 hours per day, they get loud enough to hear over the public bus noise. With the the smallest adapter, these are still a little large for my ears. I'm sure this is a function of the equipment required to drive the sound, but I purchased these partially because reviews indicated they fit smaller ears. The sound is ok. There is a lack of bass that is disappointing, but not a deal-killer.
customer_reviews.author: Maharet

customer_reviews.title: I like them - wish I'd chosen black tho
customer_reviews.text: Sounds good. Good bass & treble. Range away from device is so-so - but not bad. I have a super long bldg & it doesnt quite range all the way to the back rooms. I just don't keep phone hands-on all 24-7. Only change I'd make is my choice of color. But hey, I'm the one that hit the button. That's on me. Not sure if wick moisture because I'm at a desk at work.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best Bluetooth Headphones Ever
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best blue tooth headphones I have used. They arrived mostly charged (enough to last about 3 hours right out of the box). They paired easily with more than one device, the sound quality is excellent and they are very comfortable to wear. They also come with various size replacement ear buds and ear hooks. A great product and a great deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great but have a popping sound.
customer_reviews.text: It is great for the money but there is an unusual popping noise. I'm not sure if it is my phone or the headphones but it doesn't happen with my other Bluetooth headphones. It happens multiple times a day. I guess that is pretty good considering I use them a lot. Other then that they are comfortable and worth the money. Since I haven't seen any reviews regarding the popping noise I'm sure I just got a weird pair. It is a bit annoying but they work 98% of the time. I would recommend and have recommended them to others.
customer_reviews.author: Qsmith

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these, but they keep falling out of my ears when I move around, even when I tried the different ear inserts provided. They don't block external noise either. The sound quality is awful...no bass to speak of. I wear headphones to lift and it's very distracting, not to say dangerous, to have it pop out of the ear suddenly when I'm moving a ton of weight. I'll keep them for walks down quiet streets, nature hikes or the beach, I don't think they are good for any other environment.
customer_reviews.author: Igor H. Souza

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, great build, another great Anker product!
customer_reviews.text: Strong signal and really great sound (real bass! everything so clear!), plus, you can customize them to stay in your ears! I always have the problem of earbuds falling out, and these stay in while being comfortable. As always with Anker items, the build feel sturdy. I would recommend buying a little case to store them in. You get a nice little velvet bag, but I would opt for better protection for these than it offers - I carry them in my bag every day. Quick to pair and reliably re-pair especially if you enable Bluetooth on your device first, and then turn the SoundBuds on.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Frugal Demanding

customer_reviews.title: Awesome wireless ear buds at this price point
customer_reviews.text: I love these little headphones. They are decent for working out and for sitting at my office desk. Easy to charge, price is right...sure there are a few things I’d change (the control panel is a little clunky and heavy, you can’t go into pairing mode without turning them off and on again, and you have to hold down th3 power button for longer than the instructions indicate for all operations). However, for the price I totally love them. I’d totally repurchase them and recommend them to others.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica R.

customer_reviews.title: Quality sound, with a good connection
customer_reviews.text: I use them while working out, around the house cleaning, and driving around town. The noise cancellation is quite good even at the gym where there is all sorts of commotion. Haven't had any issues with the Bluetooth connection. The sound quality is nice for in ear head phones, rich bass and the high tones are okay, but there is not and degradation of sounds with higher volumes I have had with other in ear buds. Very secure feeling in ear while moving as well. I like Anker products and will continue to purchase them.
customer_reviews.author: MysticReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Anker! Do You Love Me? Your Headphones Dying
customer_reviews.text: These started out great but for me they were inadequate for my needs regarding working out. I will not complain about them falling out as I know everyone’s ears are different but they did fall out a few times on runs. I do sweat more than most so I will attribute that to myself as the user. However, after owning these less than a month they simply died on me and would no longer charge. I’ve had 5 Below headphones last me a year so the durability is disappointing. Sound quality was ok but save a little more and get a higher end more durable headphone in my humble opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Bluetooth Headphone
customer_reviews.text: These are great headphones. The sound is just fine for my purposes, which is mostly audiobooks and music while working out, and cleaning. It connects smoothly to my Android phone. You can adjust the size of the earbud and the "wings" separately for a nice fit. I have no problem working out in these - they stay in my ears perfectly and are very comfortable. I thought the wing part would feel awkward, but it isn't even noticeable. The only slight annoyance I have is they get a tad warm - not uncomfortably, but noticeably warm. If you also feel that the over-the-ear headphoone style is uncomfortable, definitely pick these up.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Best bluetooth headphones i've ever owned under $30
customer_reviews.text: These are incredibly durable headphones, They have great sound if you tempt your expectations. The battery lasts about what it states 5-8 hours, depending on use. They have outlasted all my other blue-tooth headphones. They recharge fairly quick, about an hour. I got two of them to switch back and forth when one of the battery drains. They stick in my ears fairly well, although the sweatier i get, the more moisture builds up in my ears and the easier they slip out.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Then I bought a pair for myself because a) I love Anker's customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these for my mom, who likes to listen to podcasts and audiobooks while gardening. Then I bought a pair for myself because a) I love Anker's customer service, and b) I have quite a few Anker products that are just great. These don't hold as much of a charge as my Bluetooth Speaker, but they are also much, much smaller. They are relatively comfortable to wear, and don't move around. I am really happy with these, especially at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Kari D.

customer_reviews.title: Died after 4 uses
customer_reviews.text: I have numerous Anker products and they are all good quality and value. These head phones fit well and sounded great for the price. However, after a full charge, each of the first three times I used them they died in less than a half hour. Today on the fourth use, they died completely. Won't even light up to take a charge anymore. I am sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: N2O2diver

customer_reviews.title: Poor mid and bass reproduction
customer_reviews.text: I’ll start by saying I am not a fan of “huge bass” in audio. While earbuds are generally flat in mid and low frequencies, these fall totally flat. Comparison to over-the-ear headphones isn’t fair, but these don’t fare well against other earbuds I own, including Sony and those shipped with apple products. The product is designed so well but the core function (audio) is poor. Treble and mid-highs are clear, but drums, bass even lows of a cello are lost. The form factor and fit are fantastic and the magnetic feature is very convenient, so this is really a shame - I want to love this product but will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: engineering_enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Was not expecting a refurbished product.
customer_reviews.text: So I just recieved my headphones and to my amazement I received a refurbished pair that were obviously used before. First the box was slightly opened with absolutely no seal or tape. Next the actual ear buds were found stuffed in the box (but they were generous to include brand new sealed accessories....thanks I guess?!). One of the plastic seals covering the Anket logos were missing on the ear buds and both hooks had signs of wear. Anker please try to do a better job passing off used items as new. Will return since I am sure someone returned these for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound with even better build quality!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. They stay in your ear especially with all the different included attachments for different ear sizes. I lost mine for a week, turns out they went through the wash. I was about to order another pair, but tried turning them on and, of course, they still worked flawlessly. Battery life wasn't affected, or sound output. Charging works, Bluetooth connectivity is perfect. How is this possible? Thank you Anker
customer_reviews.author: I Am the One who Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Terrible battery life
customer_reviews.text: I chose to wait a while instead of posting a review immediately after I received them and I am so glad I did wait. I was happy with them at first but I’ve noticed that they don’t have a good battery life. I charged them for almost 3 hours just to make sure they would have a full battery, but only after two hours of use over the span of two days ( I also made sure to turn them off when I wasn’t using them), they are already drained of power. This is ridiculous. Definitely returning them back.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes G.

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds...
customer_reviews.text: Great earbuds for the price and 1.5 yr warranty. I originally purchased 2 pairs, but one stopped working after 3 months (no longer turned on or charged). HOWEVER -- I contacted their customer service and they quickly sent me a replacement pair after showing proof of purchase and trying a couple of troubleshooting methods. That said, while I did have a failed pair, A+ for their customer service and over all quality (the 2nd pair on original order is still working perfectly). Would recommend to others and purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: SUCCESSFUL HEADPHONES, NO BATTERY ISSUES, HUMANS ARE SILLY
customer_reviews.text: Look, they are headphones. Mostly wireless, I say mostly because look at them. There is a wire connecting the two headphones. They are fantastic at being headphones. They do exactly what you need them to do. Some on here complain about battery life. I have had zero battery life issues. The only time I have a "battery issue" its because it was a human issue (i.e. I would leave the headphones on for a day or more and then go "Why is this dead" -- well its dead because I left it running for 24+ hours straight).
customer_reviews.author: Sentinel

customer_reviews.title: but I LOVE these! I just went for a 4
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical because the price was so reasonable, but I LOVE these! I just went for a 4.5 mile run in 90 degree humid weather and these stayed in my tiny ears the whole time! I like these better than my apple ones because these stay put and are more comfortable. The sound quality is pretty good and they block outside noise well also. These are great for all size ears, even small ones, because they come with different size ear hooks and tips. I would buy these again!
customer_reviews.author: InTheAspens

customer_reviews.title: Good overall set of ear buds with medium battery storage capacity for the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall, these ear buds work well. They are easy to setup and pair with bluetooth devices. I've tried pairing with my laptop and phone, and both times it worked fine. The biggest issue I had is that when I have paired the ear buds with my laptop and then I get on a Skype call, the ear buds stop working. I can hear everyone else on the call, but they cannot hear me, no matter how much I play around with the mute settings etc. The battery gets used up quite fast and so charging is a bit more frequent than I anticipated, but for the price I had to pay, I do not mind.
customer_reviews.author: deep

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for strugglin college students
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I use them on my weekly commute and during yardwork, cleaning, etc. The sound quality is great for the price. Its nothing amazing, the treble and bass wont knock your socks off. but compared to $100+ air pods and sub $20 generic earbuds, these are the obvious choice for those looking for good sound quality without the audiophile price. My only real gripe is the range. I like to listen to podcasts while doing the dishes or working around the house, now usually I leave my phone in my room so its safe, but if you go beyond 10 feet the bluetooth signal deteriorates quickly. If you can get passed that then I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: ted

customer_reviews.title: Great...if they actually would hold the charge
customer_reviews.text: I love the way they fit. The mic part could be a bit better, as everyone says I just sound like I'm on speaker phone, but that's not why I bought them. I needed wireless headphones for while I'm working. I needed something that I could use and not have to worry about. These are fine, but after 3-4 hours, they are dead. I charge them, turn them off when I'm not using them, but they die fast. I'd give them a better rating, if it wasn't for the battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa G.

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe the quality of craftsmanship and sound!
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews and I had some earbuds that didn't fit or sounded like garbage. I was hoping these were as good as people say. They are better!!! The sound quality is astounding, great bass, they have controls that are lightweight, the buds are strong and durable. No cheap plastic. There's a nice magnet that keeps them together and a great velvet bag with a self closing clasp to keep them in. I never look for my old buds anymore. These are the real deal. This is my 4th Anker product and each item has such quality and durability to it. I am an Anker customer all the way now!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Tasker

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. I misplaced my first, but found them a month later. Best feature is the rubber "Ear Tips" stay on unlike other headphones. I use them mainly at the gym and for yard work. Comfortable as well. Battery life is several hours. I am not an audiophile, but I think they sound pretty good for music and podcasts.
customer_reviews.author: TexLex_photo

customer_reviews.title: Big quality for a low price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a gift for my wife. She isn’t exactly an audiophile, but she praised these as being on par with comparable Skullcandy earbuds. They have fantastic battery life and more than satisfactory microphones for moving around the house and being heard. Now, we live in the southern U.S. and heat is always bearing down on us. Sweating has not been an issue with these headphones at all. They provide a good deal for sound quality and are durable with constant movement and sweat resistance. I highly recommend these earbuds as a lower priced alternative to higher end models. They get the job done with longevity and quality.
customer_reviews.author: AverageJosh

customer_reviews.title: Good for music only
customer_reviews.text: Good for listening and easy setup. Horrible for noise isolation and having a phonecall. While outside or in a office background noise can be heard and hard for people to hear. Also not give for people with a large neck the mic is often covered if wear both ear pieces. I found the range to be hit or miss when away from your phone i.e. letting it charge in your kitchen then stepping away you have about 30-50ft. Not much base but good enough in my opinion for heavy bass like songs.
customer_reviews.author: Jon L

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Price but The Battery Life Leaves Something to Be Desired
customer_reviews.text: They're comfortable, sound quality is as good as anything else I've used regarding Bluetooth earbuds, excellent accessories, but the battery life has never lasted more than 2-2.5 hours and I've used their charging cord every time (people should pay attention to that with every Bluetooth ear bud device btw) so, overall, a pretty good product, but when using them while working out or being outdoors for very long then I would consider other options.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Quit working
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband for running. They worked great for about a month but this morning they just turned off and won't turn back on. We've tried charging them and they won't even charge. UPDATE: As soon as Anker saw my post about the ear buds not working anymore they immediately emailed me and sent me a new pair! I got the new pair in 2 days and they even emailed again to verify I got the new pair and they were working! A+++++ for amazing customer service! The new pair is working great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Great headset. Mic is not great.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. Battery life is great (though I'm sure they would be easy to snap in some places). Ear quality is quite good and the ear buds are comfortable (if you pick the correct size of flange from the 3 provided). The mic quality is poor, in large part because the mic bounces a lot and doesn't like to face the correct way.
customer_reviews.author: A. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Does the job with good Anker support
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair of these for my son for Christmas for his iPhone. Worked great but one of the buds stopped working about 6 months of use. They were still within warranty so after contacting Anker, they sent us a new pair (was an upgrade actually). Painless process with quick turnaround. For the price and support, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: dinkelburt

customer_reviews.title: Consistency if performance and durability
customer_reviews.text: Amazing headphones! I bought these a couple of months ago and have used them sporadically during my travels and have been extremely impressed with the sound quality, consistency of performance and durability. These hold charge well. I know that since i some times turn them off and want to use them a couple of days later and guess what - it’s still held its charge. Very impressive for $20 price.
customer_reviews.author: shashi2

customer_reviews.title: Lasted < 4 months :(
customer_reviews.text: Anker is the best when it comes to electronic accessories. I always check this brand first whenever I need something. Clear sound. Nice bass, not tinny. Easy to pair with my phone. Love it! Update: I loved these so much I bought a second pair. It has been less than 4 months and they no longer pair with my phone. The phone sees them (in the list of Bluetooth devices), but never connects. Nothing works. I still love Anker, but I can not recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: A. Santarelli

customer_reviews.title: Great product, Shorter playtime than expected
customer_reviews.text: Loving these that I just bought. Sound quality is good, especially for the price. I wear these around the back of my neck, so the cord tends to pull towards the right side (because it's heavier from the controls) but not really a big deal. The only issue I have is the short battery life - It's advertised at 7 hours of playtime, but I'm only seeing roughly 2.5 hours of playback. It's just enough if i were to use it for an exercise session, but not nearly long enough to use while working a full shift. I think it takes about 1-1.5 hours to fully charge again.
customer_reviews.author: Drigonaut

customer_reviews.title: Solid pair of wireless headphones and not too expensive
customer_reviews.text: I just got these today and really like them. They're lighter than any other bluetooth headphones I've owned and the sound quality is great. I like the price. $36 for full price and $26 on sale (I wanted the blue ones). These are cheaper and more comfortable than my Skullcandy wireless ones and way better than the JayBirds I had earlier than that. A solid pair of headphones and I would buy them again at this price and quality. I love Anker's charging bricks, but they also make great headphones with everything I want in them: easy to pair, easy to wear, lightweight, and they come with a variety of tips to get the fit right for your ears.
customer_reviews.author: gamerchick02

customer_reviews.title: High Hopes and Ultimately Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The microphone is terrible. Consistently people told me the sound quality was poor and faded in & out. I have Pixel 3. For just listening to music they were adequate and unimpressive. I love so many other Anker products I had high hopes. Also, on my new Macbook Pro they worked inconsistently.
customer_reviews.author: W. OBrien

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service, quickly replaced broken pair
customer_reviews.text: About a month after I bought these the left one stopped working. I contacted Anker support through their website and after having me try a couple of things to confirm they were actually broken, they shipped me a new pair which arrived within a couple of days. The new pair have been working great for three months and counting. I use them every single day and I'm very happy with them. They're great headphones for the price and my experience with their customer service was also great. Highly recommended if you're looking for an affordable pair of wireless headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Jer

customer_reviews.title: Great product with best customer service
customer_reviews.text: My son has used this bluetooth headphone for almost a year, absolutely loving it until one of the speakers stopped working. Anker provided customer service that seems mythical but true. They made it easy (and friendly) to prove that the product failed, and then they replaced the broken device quickly. A search on my Amazon orders history shows that I have purchased 32 Anker products for my family. I will continue to prefer products from this excellent company.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lim

customer_reviews.title: Great price, good sound, does its job well.
customer_reviews.text: I run. In Texas. In the summer. These do exactly what I need them to do. Battery life is pretty confined to one or two uses before needing to be recharged. Considering their compact, minimalist size however, four to five hours battery life from a sweat/water resistant headphone that delivers good sound and is super light at this price point is a win. this is not stellar A+ sound (solid A-), but they’re comfortable, light, and at this price point can’t be beat. Anker has been an all around good brand for me and it remains so.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and magnetic.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these. Especially the magnet part. I was worried because j lose blue tooth stuff all the time. Since they are magnetic I just hook them around my strap on my bag. They also have an amazing sound. I use them for phone calls. Also the ear pieces have the typical marshmallow ear part and then have an extra part that can be removed that helps to hold them in your ear.
customer_reviews.author: kristen jackson

customer_reviews.title: They are very good earbuds.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pairs of these: one for me, and one for my wife. She was skeptical at first, since they're more expensive than just replacing the wired ones that came with her iPhone, but now she loves them. Both of us use these every day at work. The battery lasts long enough to get through the workday, the earpieces are comfortable and isolate well (several different sizes are included), they never feel like they're going to fall out, the magnets are cool, and the sound quality is great for both music and phone calls. The anodized aluminum housings give them a high-quality look and feel.
customer_reviews.author: Rosin

customer_reviews.title: Good for listening, not talking
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are not bad for the price - they sound good. However, battery life is poor, and when I talk on the phone it picks up all the noise in the room and the person on the other end cannot hear. So the mic is not very good.
customer_reviews.author: Max W.

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as older models
customer_reviews.text: I had the all black set prior to the blue ones. Battery is the same. The buttons are a little better. But the control between the headset and the phone are not the same. The buttons only control the sound on the headphones themselves, they don't work in sync with the phone. And that's frustrating, as the previous version did.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: These are a great value compared to other headphones that cost several times more. The sound quality is not great, but I find it acceptable. If sound quality is the most important thing for you, I'd suggest looking for something more expensive. Otherwise, I think these are a great value. The build quality is solid, I find them comfortable to wear, and the battery life has been good.
customer_reviews.author: Glass

customer_reviews.title: These are the best earbuds I've ever had!
customer_reviews.text: If you are someone like me who doesn't like to spend $100 on headphones, so you buy cheap $10 ones from TJ maxx - WOW these are AMAZING! I finally got some bluetooth headphones since my pixel phone doesn't have a headphone jack. These have been amazing - they stay in my ear SUPER well, even when working out or running. I bike to work every day and use them as well. It is so nice not getting tangled in headphone lines when getting on and off my bike. Overall - love these. You should get them.
customer_reviews.author: WCSDLT

customer_reviews.title: SlimBuds are the Best Kept Secret in Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for about a month, and they're wonderful. Sound quality is well balanced. I was gifted a pair of Beats earbuds for Christmas, and these are better--a little less bass, but much more clarity in the high end. For the price, these are an absurdly good deal. I also have had absolutely no Bluetooth connection issues. The only thing I'd like is more batter power as these only get about seven hours on a full charge. If they break tomorrow, I'll immediately order a new pair. Anker is a great company.
customer_reviews.author: Justin K.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bluetooth phones for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bluetooth phones for the price. Fit is good and maintains good adhesion in the ear with most all activities. I use this primarily while exercising and underneath noise reduction ear muffs for hearing protection while cutting grass. The first pair I received inexplicably stopped working after about 3 weeks. Customer service was very quick to respond and very professional. Sent a replacement out in 3 days. Very pleased with this purchase. I would buy again, and will purchase for others. Customer service excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Todd A. Gallman

customer_reviews.title: Customer service excellent
customer_reviews.text: These held up decently well over the course of a year, but once a wire inevitably started to get worn out, causing the sound to short, I reached out to Anker to see what they could do. They walked me through some troubleshooting just to confirm my issues, but promptly sent me a new pair. Worth it just for that experience. Pros: Customer service, sound quality, stay-in-earability, battery life (although degrades after a year or so like all will) Cons: The mic picks everything up, so you have to be really intentional if you're using it for phone calls.
customer_reviews.author: S. Manciagli

customer_reviews.title: You can't find a better wireless headphone option for less
customer_reviews.text: You can't find a better wireless headphone option for less. In fact, I'd say you'd have to spend a lot more to find better too. These are great for around the office listening as well as running at the gym or outdoors. They've put up with loads of sweat and a decent amount of rain without any issues. They sound great and seem to fit very well too. I haven't had any concern of them falling out or anything.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hammons

customer_reviews.title: Quality yet inexpensive product that does what I wanted it to.
customer_reviews.text: The sound buds come with sized ear foam and ear loop pieces to modify them to fit your preferences. I have not gotten them wet just to see how well they handle water, but I am very pleased with the sound quality, the weight and the appearance. I bought two of them - one for me and one for my wife. We are both pleased. P.S. I do not know how long the battery charge lasts, I have been using them about an hour per day during fitness time (a couple times a week) and after around 5 hours have still not needed to charge them from existing charge on delivery.
customer_reviews.author: rodney jones

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product with equally great price!
customer_reviews.text: Received the product within 2 days with Amazon Prime. Fortunately for me, the ear tips and in-ear hooks that were on the soundbuds fit me perfectly, therefore no fussing required with the fit (which appears to be quite easy, either way.) Pairing the unit with my iPhone went without a hitch and within 2 minutes of opening this package, I was grooving to my tunes! Love the sound and so easy to use. Bonus is the magnetic tips that keep the Soundbuds around my neck with I don't have them in my ears. Love, love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Woods

customer_reviews.title: can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: The product you receive for the price you pay is outstanding. The sound quality won't necessarily beat the more expensive brands, so if that's what you're looking for, consider that. However, if your concern is spending a smart amount on a decent pair of headphones you can workout in, move around in, and use as a wireless set, this is your best choice. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding headphones easy to use and changed by gym ...
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding headphones easy to use and changed by gym experience after putting up with wired headphones for so long. However, they did go completely dead after 5 months, but Anker's customer service replaced them within 4 days of my contacting them, no questions asked. So unexpectedly great customer service. There are better sounding headphones out there, but for the price these are great.
customer_reviews.author: JonMil

customer_reviews.title: great product, Awesome Customer service
customer_reviews.text: I really loved these headphones however they broke recently and I was heartbroken because I love them so much. However I support was super awesome and send me a replacement pair right away without asking me to send them b I really loved these headphones however they broke recently and I was heartbroken because I love them so much. However support was super awesome and sent me a replacement pair right away without asking me to Send the broken ones back. Really awesome customer service
customer_reviews.author: tatyana litvinova

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, easy to pair, good water resistance. Bought as a Lightening deal.
customer_reviews.text: These came fully charged and I was able to pair them within seconds. They do get loud but you will notice some distortion at higher volumes. I bought them to wear primarily while I do yard work and I can hear the music clearly over the lawn mower; was even able to take a call while still mowing with the caller able to hear me. They seem to have a decent range and battery life even at high volume. The battery actually outlasts my phone's battery, which has died on me twice while working outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Heather S.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and fit
customer_reviews.text: I own several of Anker's chargers and cords, and have found them all to be of high quality. These headphones definitely keep with that tradition. They have great, full sound with impressive bass. I especially like the way they fit and the quality of the hooks and earpieces, which stay firmly connected... more than I can say for a similar pair of headphones from "SoundPEATS" I bought before these whose hooks and earpieces constantly came loose. (I see those are no longer even available, no surprise there) Play time on a full charge seems like it may be a *bit* less than the 7 hours advertised... but other than that, a great choice at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: S. Makhlouf

customer_reviews.title: Quality Wireless Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These pair easily and stay connected, good audio, but the battery seems to slowly discharge even when off or in 'sleep' mode. For the price, I would recommend these, as long as you plug them in when not in use. February 2019: the right earpiece now only "crackles", making these basically unusable. Would not purchase these again, especially at their price point.
customer_reviews.author: Brewmeister

customer_reviews.title: Best for the price
customer_reviews.text: Of all the other 20-30$ headphones I've tried and returned, this is the best noise canceling one jve found that is also very comfortable. It stays in relatively well, but I would recommend over the ear ones if you step running. Lifting at the gym would work with these ear buds
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: 6 stars for service, 2 stars for headphones
customer_reviews.text: Quiet. As. *! Crystal clear sound, custom fit with some work (medium in one ear, small in the other), not as loud as a crappy pair of 8 year old wired Iphone head phones. disappointing. you've been warned. Updated: Still not loud enough, but Anker support was awesome and reached out multiple times to suggest another pair, which they sent for free! The NB10's that they sent are amazing, and significantly louder. Another issue with the Slim soundbuds - I sweat a lot, and the cord between them sticks to my skin and eventually pulls the earbuds out. The band on the NB10's is much better in this regard.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: No battery--UPDATED
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: A new product was sent to me at no additional charge and they work great so far, thank you for the customer service! I ordered these a couple of months ago and have only been able to use them a handful of times. Despite being sure to turn them off, the battery is dead every time I go to use them. Very disappointed because I loved my original soundbuds and was looking forward to "upgrading."
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Lenzi

customer_reviews.title: Compareable With Jaybirds.
customer_reviews.text: I had the Jaybirds X3 and the suddenly failed. I refused to buy 150$ earphones again since they only lasted for 8 months. I bought this ones insted because I havr almost every product anker offers since they are the best. THIS PRODUCT IS NO EXEPTION. Like any other product from anker IT IS THE BEST totally worth it. MY FIRST THOUGHT when i got them was " Why did I pay 150$ for Jaybirds if these ones sound so good for 30ish dollars". I would recommend them 11 out of 10 times
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, good customer support
customer_reviews.text: When I decided to get Bluetooth headphones, there were a bunch to choose from at Amazon in the $25-$30 range. I bought the Anker SoundBuds Slim, and I've been pleased. I use them several times a week, usually wearing them while working out (playing basketball, doing weights, or elliptical). I've had them for 1 year and 3 months at this point, and the battery lasts somewhere between 2 and 3 hours. The customer support is very good as well. For what it's worth, if I lost these, I'd buy another Anker SoundBuds Slim.
customer_reviews.author: SomethingLatin

customer_reviews.title: Anker support is the best
customer_reviews.text: My first pair lasted me 6 months of daily abuse. I sleep with these on and wear them at work. Plus, I am not exactly careful with them.. Regardless, they come with a warranty and I expect the warranty to be upheld. After 6 months, one ear quit working. Michelle from AnkerDirect Customer Support assisted with my warranty claim, she was fantastic! I received a new pair in a few days. Very happy Anker customer!
customer_reviews.author: J.Foley

customer_reviews.title: connection isn't always flawless, but cheap
customer_reviews.text: I use this almost everyday listen to streaming radio at office, the batt last about 5-6 hours and it is secure and very comfortable. For the price it is ok. Hang it on my neck they don't get lost with the magnet. Knock a star off coz it occasionally lost connection for half a sec. I don't have the same issue with my car Bluetooth nor my other BT headsets. So dont expect it to perform like $100 buds.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Battery Acid leaking..no longer a good product
customer_reviews.text: Update: Battery acid has now started leaking out of the left headphone and is unusable... Solid pair of Bluetooth ear buds for the price. Sounds great. Has not run out of power yet and easy to set up. Have not figured out how to skip music with inline controls if even possible. The wing tips are okay.. mostly stay in my ear but not sure how well they would hold up through continuous use.
customer_reviews.author: Npalumbo89

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the Price
customer_reviews.text: These things stay in my ears pretty well and are comfortable for up to a couple of hours. So, perfect for a workout, run, etc. The sound is nice and clear, if not all that powerful. The mic picks up fine while I'm running around doing stuff that requires my hands, and the control buttons are where I'd expect them to be. They're my "take them everywhere" pair now. Haven't had any connection issues, and I like the magnetic backs that keep them secure and handy between uses. They didn't blow me away in general, but they get 5 stars because they are pretty impressive for the price ($20).
customer_reviews.author: TheIndex

product_meta.title: Bluetooth Headphones, Anker SoundBuds Slim Wireless Workout Headphones,10-Hour Playtime, Bluetooth 5.0, IPX7 Waterproof Magnetic Wireless Earbuds, Bluetooth Earbuds for Sports, Exercise, Running, Gym
product_meta.description:
Color:BlueSoundBuds Slim
The Lightweight Earbuds that Defy Sweat and Rain.

High-Fidelity Audio
6mm drivers deliver crisp, clear music to your ears via a smooth, skip-free connection.

Built For Active Lifestyles
SoundBuds Slim are designed to be slimline and light (15g), while offering serious performance. Magnetically attach together when not in use, or tuck away into the travel pouch.

Customizable Fit
Multi-size EarTips and InEar-Hooks provide a sturdy, comfortable hold. Cable measures 55cm for universal fit and no annoying tangles. Adjust your cable length with the FitClip, or affix to your clothing for extra security via the Shirt Clip.

Water Resistant
IPX7 water-resistant shell and internal nano-coating ensures complete defence against liquids. Push yourself to your limit during workouts and SoundBuds Slim will handle your audio effortlessly.

Listen Longer
Play for up to 10 hours; longer than most earphones on the market. Bluetooth 5 ensures a connection range of up to 33 ft, compatible with the iPhone 7 or any Bluetooth device.

Intuitive Control
In-built microphone and 3-button remote enable you to manage more conveniently - from skipping a song, to answering a call without touching your phone.

Worry-Free Warranty
At Anker, we believe in our products. That's why we back them all with an 18-month warranty and provide friendly, easy-to-reach support.

Note:
If you want to recharge these earbuds after exercising, please follow these steps:

1. Open the port cover and shake to remove any sweat from inside the USB port.

2. Wipe the USB charging port dry with a cotton cloth.

3. Charge with a 5V certified charger and cable.

4. Make sure the port cover is fully closed after charging.

*Playtime varies according to volume level and audio content.
feature_bullets: IPX7 Waterproof: Sound Buds Slim Bluetooth earbuds are defended by a fully waterproof casing that’s based on a submarine’s structure. Push yourself during your workout without fear of sweat and rain damaging your earphones. You can even rinse them with water when cleaning.
Extreme Stamina: 10 hours of playtime (at 80% volume) gives you the power and motivation needed to fuel over a week of workouts.
High-fidelity Sound: 6 mm Composite Bio-cellulose diaphragm drivers reproduce your music with crystal-clear clarity.
Secure and Comfortable Fit: The Bluetooth earbuds are ergonomically designed and come with Ear Tips and Earwigs in various sizes to tailor the fit to you.
Fast charging: when you’re in a rush, a 10-minute charge will provide you with up to 2 hours of continuous listening.
Note: This product is not currently compatible with iPhone 11 Series, but is being upgraded.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,688 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
